frontmatter.titlepage:
Inventory of the Charles C. Rensie Letter, 1862- A Collection in the
Special Collections Research Center Mss. Acc. 2006.55
Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary 2010 &contact;
Processed By

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Letter from Union Soldier Charles C. Rensie of Yorktown, Virginia, dated April 29, 1862, to an unknown recipient. It describes his anxiety in preparation for the siege of Yorktown. 3 p. on 1 leaf; 20 x 13 cm.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Research Center, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Charles C. Rensie Letter, Special Collections Research Center, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Information about this individual or organization may be available in the Special Collections Research Center Wiki

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Union Soldier Charles C. Rensie of Yorktown, Virginia, dated April 29, 1862, to an unknown recipient. It describes his anxiety in preparation for the siege of Yorktown. 3 p. on 1 leaf; 20 x 13 cm.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.
